meanings.sent1: She was nilling to eat her vegetables at dinner.
meanings.sent2: The child's nilling behavior made it challenging for the teacher.
meanings.sent3: Even though he was hungry, his nilling attitude towards the meal was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: Her nilling nature was like a stubborn rock, unmoved by persuasion.
meanings.sent5: The cat's nilling refusal to come inside was as firm as a closed door.

meanings.definition: The act of refusing to accept or agree to something.
meanings.sent1: His constant nilling of the rules led to many conflicts.
meanings.sent2: The company faced a setback due to the employee's nilling of the new policy.
meanings.sent3: The toddler's nilling of bedtime turned into a playful game of hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent4: The politician's nilling of the proposed law was a bold stand against injustice.
meanings.sent5: The student's nilling of the assignment was like a protest against homework.
